div.p: WALK TOGETHER with AND BEHIND.
1. The dominant current word for moving along behind someone or something else, both in concrete and in abstract senses, is cóng 從 (ant. bèi 背 "be in opposition against").
2. Suí 隨 is to move along literally behind someone, by a deliberate act of volition.

3. Zūn 遵 refers primarily to the kind of deliberate following of a path, behaviour that is motivated by respect for what one follows, but sometimes the word is also used in a more generalised way referring to a person following a certain physical guideline without any suggestion of respect for this guideline, as in MENG 遵海而南 "head south along the shore of the sea".
4. Xún 循 is to follow certain guidelines or a certain prescribed path, as a matter of prudential strategy, and typically in a rather mechanical or habitual manner.
5. Yǎn 沿 is to follow a physical guideline (like a river bank) in a mechanical way.
6. Hòu 後 and zhǒng 踵 is to follow literally in the footsteps of someone.
7. Tīng 聽 refers to the abstract notion of following advice given to one as a superior. See OBEY
8. Yì 役 and xùn 徇 are fairly rare when used as words referring to the deliberate act of becoming someone's follower or employee.
9. Xí 襲 refers to a mechanical course of action in conformity with some pattern.
10. Zé 則 refers to the following of a certain abstract principle or model person to which due attention is paid. See CONFORM
跟隨
尾隨
隨從
釘 refers to to following someone closely.
跟
隨
踵
從
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: 103. Inter Consequimur et assequimur. Consequimur pedibus, assequimur studio.

sense.def: follow naturally, obey in an unforced way (the law etc) 安法
treat as one's leader, follow as one's leader
treat the determinate object as a leader, follow the example of the determinate object
follow the example (constituted by something); follow as a duty

entry.def: Yì 役 and xùn 徇 are fairly rare when used as words referring to the deliberate act of becoming someone's follower or employee.

sense.def: enlist as a follower (understood: of Confucius)

entry.def: Yì 役 and xùn 徇 are fairly rare when used as words referring to the deliberate act of becoming someone's follower or employee.

sense.def: decide to follow or join the staff of; join as a supporter

entry.def: Hòu 後 and zhǒng 踵 is to follow literally in the footsteps of someone.

sense.def: cause to follow; cause to come last

entry.def: The dominant current word for moving along behind someone or something else, both in concrete and in abstract senses, is cóng 從 (ant. bèi 背 "be in opposition against").

sense.def: in pursuit of/following in the footsteps of the contextually determinate object N
following a contextually determinate person along
follow along with a contextually determinate person
following; moving along with; as a follower of
literally: follow after, go along with, come along
cause to become a follower, invite to become a follower
become a follower of; be a follower of; become a disciple of; follow and obey (a person) as a follower
follow N1 until the place N2
following, in conjunction with and under the leadership of
figurative: cause to follow long, cause to follow suit
figurative: join the followers and supporters of; start following

entry.def: Xún 循 is to follow certain guidelines or a certain prescribed path, as a matter of prudential strategy, and typically in a rather mechanical or habitual manner.

sense.def: follow the same course of action as
follow the course of (a shore, a river etc)

entry.def: Yǎn 沿 is to follow a physical guideline (like a river bank) in a mechanical way.

sense.def: follow, go along (a river bank, or some line in the territory)
follow; adopt; follow the example of

entry.def: Tīng 聽 refers to the abstract notion of following advice given to one as a superior. See OBEY

sense.def: the practice of following advice; the listening to advice
obey commands or follow demands from a contextually determinate person
to cause a determinate person to follow (something N)
do as one is bidden by; follow (advice)
be listened to, be followed (as advice)

entry.def: Xí 襲 refers to a mechanical course of action in conformity with some pattern. See CONFORM

sense.def: follow in the footsteps of; follow step by step; be in alliance with; also: go through (the lower ranks) (where does this meaning go?)

entry.def: Hòu 後 and zhǒng 踵 is to follow literally in the footsteps of someone.

sense.def: follow, follow in the footsteps of, follow the traces of (a contextually determinate person)

entry.def: Zūn 遵 refers primarily to the kind of deliberate following of a path, behaviour that is motivated by respect for what one follows, but sometimes the word is also used in a more generalised way referring to a person following a certain physical guideline without any suggestion of respect for this guideline, as in MENG 遵海而南"head south along the shore of the sea".

sense.def: follow; walk along with a contextually determinate object
follow (the bank of a river); follow along; follow the course of; pass through in following one's course
keep faithfully and earnestly to the path of

entry.def: Suí 隨 is to move along literally behind someone, by a deliberate act of volition.

sense.def: ensue; follow behind (rather than go in front); trail behind and follow
take as one's guideline 因民之欲 "follow the desires of the people"
follow the smoothly; fit into the context
= yán 沿: to make N follow oneself, to make N obedient
